transcript.title: GENERAL JOHN BAKER AC DSM
transcript.content:
I was saddened to learn of the death today of General John Baker AC DSM.

General Baker had a distinguished career in the Australian Defence Force, culminating in his appointment as Chief of Defence Force from 1995 to 1998.

I knew General Baker well. He was the first Chief of Defence Force I worked with when I came to office in 1996 and I valued his sage advice in that period.

His leadership of the Defence Force through a significant period of change, including integration of the military and civilian arms of Defence, was inspirational.

General Baker continued to serve Australia with distinction after his retirement, making a valuable contribution to many community groups including Australia Day in the National Capital.

General Baker was an outstanding public servant and a deserving recipient of our nation's highest honour when appointed as a Companion in the Order of Australia. Janette joins me in extending our deepest sympathy to General Baker's family on the loss of a fine Australian.
